sn4.13:2.1: Māra thinks that “drunk on poetry” (kāveyyamatta, see SN 8.12:2.1) means literally drunk. In Rig Veda 10.131.4, Indra, drunk on an excess of soma, needs the illicit beer of Namuci (= Māra) to revive him. Perhaps we see in this phrase an echo of the Vedic tradition of taking intoxicants so that the god speaks through you in inspired verse.
